description.narrative: By 2017, institutional duty bearers have strengthened capacity to deliver sustainable safe drinking water, improved sanitation services and hygiene practices with a focus on the most disadvantaged children

sector.narrative: Sanitation - improving services in rural communities (except household water treatment and storage, moving up the ladder and strengthening sustainability)

description.narrative: Water supply and Sanitation policy, planning and administration

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2017, institutional duty bearers have strengthened capacity to deliver sustainable safe drinking water, improved sanitation services and hygiene practices with a focus on the most disadvantaged children

description.narrative: UNICEF continued to strengthen the capacity of provincial governments including district WASH Committees, (government and NGOs) to end open defecation and gain access to safe water. UNICEF's support to government resulted in 661,657 people (including men, women and children) gaining access to safe drinking water | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:31/12/2017

title.narrative: Existence of functioning service delivery arrangement for water, sanitation and hygiene

WATER SUPPLY (non Emergency and Early Recovery): # People (incl.children and women) with access to sufficient water of appropriate quality and quantity for drinking, cooking and maintaining personal hygiene
WASH capacity assessment report and recommendation

actual.value:
2017: KP/FATA WASH capacity assessment will be conducted under WASH Sector Plan development activity.
Punjab WASH capacity assessment report was finalized and a well-defined strategic Human Resource Development Plan was developed and approved to align the capacities with WASH Sector Development Plan an
